newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar closes stable in active trade.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar closes stable in active trade.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar finished little changed in active Wednesday trade as supply and demand for the U.S. dollar were balanced, dealers said.
The local unit ended at T$27.515 against Tuesday's T$27.519 close. Turnover was an active US$229 million.

The Taiwan dollar fell as low as T$27.540 on importers's U.S. dollar buying, but exporters' U.S. dollar sales balanced the rate, dealers said. "Sentiment in the market is fairly stable at the moment and there is no strong incentive to move the rate in either direction," said one dealer. A range of T$27.49-53 was seen for Thursday. -- Alice Hung (2-5080815)
